definition: Austria/Austrian/abbr. for 奧地利|奥地利[Ao4 di4 li4]/Olympic/Olympics/abbr. for 奧林匹克|奥林匹克[Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4]
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa

sentences.english: Women in the barracks at Auschwitz in January 1945.
sentences.chinese: 這是1945年在奧斯維辛營房的女人。

sentences.english: There was the fear of selections, but it wasn`t as bad as at Auschwitz.
sentences.chinese: 挑選人有種恐懼，但沒有在奧斯維辛集中營裏那麼遭。

sentences.english: Some 450,000 people a year visited Auschwitz in 2000.
sentences.chinese: 在2000年就有將近45萬人來奧斯維辛遊覽。

sentences.english: Ryszard is one of the youngest known survivors of Auschwitz.
sentences.chinese: 雷尚德也是奧斯維辛集中營中倖存的最小的孩子之一。

sentences.english: The train journey to Auschwitz took three days.
sentences.chinese: 火車開往奧斯維辛行駛了三天。
